alert.note: Alert for Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Misty Fjords; Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 5:03PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN POSSIBLE WITH RISING SNOW LEVELS LATE WEEK... Signals continue to point to a possible atmospheric river event late this week into the weekend including warming temperatures, rising snow levels, and the potential for accumulating snow before changing to heavy rain. Initially the heaviest rain is expected to be focused on the northern panhandle. The moisture stream is expected to gradually slide southward through the weekend, but there is uncertainty regarding the timing and duration of heavy rain over the central and southern Panhandle. The current forecast is for rainfall amounts of 2-4 inches from Thursday evening through Sunday, with the heaviest precipitation possible on Sunday. Snow levels are forecast to rise to 4,000 to 6,000 feet. Rain along with a melting mountain snowpack will increase the risk of minor flooding issues. Please stay tuned to the forecast as it is refined through the week.
